com.undercamber

Class Path

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.undercamber.Path

  • public final class Path
extends java.lang.Object
    A convenience class to build path-like strings in a platform-independent way.

    Entries have string expansion enabled, as describe in StringExpander.

    By default, entries in this list can optionally have simple validation performed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates an empty path.

      Creates a path initialized with the specified entries.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Path

        public Path()
        Creates an empty path.

      • Path

        public Path(java.lang.String... entries)
     throws UserError,
            InternalException
        Creates a path initialized with the specified entries.
        Parameters:
        entries - The initial entries
        Throws:
        UserError - If one of the entries is not properly formatted for string expansion, or one of the entries does not point to a location on disk.
        InternalException - If there is internal difficulty expanding the strings.

      • Path

        public Path(Path original)
        Create a copy.

        Changes to the original have no effect on the copy, and vice versa.

        No string expansion is performed.

        Parameters:
        original - The original from which to make a copy.

    • Method Detail

      • addEntries

        public final void addEntries(java.lang.String... entries)
                      throws UserError,
                             InternalException
        Add entries to the path.

        This is equivalent to

            addEntries( ValidationLevel.ERROR,
                entries );
        Parameters:
        entries - The entries to append to the path.
        Throws:
        UserError - If one of the entries is not properly formatted for string expansion, or one of the entries does not point to a location on disk.
        InternalException - If there is internal difficulty expanding the strings.

      • addEntries

        public final void addEntries(ValidationLevel validationLevel,
                             java.lang.String... entries)
                      throws UserError,
                             InternalException
        Add entries to the path.

        Parameters:
        validationLevel - The validation level to use when validating the entries.
        entries - The entries to append to the path.
        Throws:
        UserError - If one of the entries is not properly formatted for string expansion, or one of the entries does not point to a location on disk.
        InternalException - If there is internal difficulty expanding the strings.

      • addEntries

        public final void addEntries(java.util.List<java.lang.String> entries)
                      throws UserError,
                             InternalException
        Add entries to the path.

        This is equivalent to

            addEntries( entries,
                ValidationLevel.ERROR );
        Parameters:
        entries - The entries to append to the path.
        Throws:
        UserError - If one of the entries is not properly formatted for string expansion, or one of the entries does not point to a location on disk.
        InternalException - If there is internal difficulty expanding the strings.

        Throws:
